titlepage.titleproper:
Finding Aid for
In Bolshevik hands, 1918-1920, undated.
titlepage.author:
Finding aid prepared by:
Len Coombs

did.abstract: Reminiscence of Robert Dawson, a soldier in the Royal Scots who served in Archangel, Russia, 1918-1919, and later taken prisoner by the Bolsheviks.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by Mrs. Jesse Parks in 2010 (Donor no.: 10348).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

prefercite.p: item, folder title, box no., In Bolshevik hands, 1918-1920, by Robert Dawson, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Robert Dawson was a soldier in the Royal Scots who served in Archangel, Russia 1918-1919, and later taken prisoner by the Bolsheviks.

scopecontent.p: The reminiscence (41 p., photocopy) details his capture, stays in hospital, observations of the Russian people, buildings, social customs, and his subsequent release.
